<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew’s MB/A accelerator program will speed up your career like a rabbit with 16 legs. In just eight weeks, you’ll gain relevant operational skills, learn from startup visionaries, and network with a bunch of other people also looking to level up. Who knows? Maybe you’ll meet the Benioff to your Weiss (before Season 8).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, through the MB/A program we learned that all great marketers create a sense of urgency, so here goes nothing: The deadline to apply is <strong style="color:#000"><em>this Sunday</em></strong>. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/senate-passes-1-trillion-infrastructure-bill-heres-context?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When You Hear Lawmakers Worked Together
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Monkey being surprised GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=457 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o72F8t9TDi2xVnxOE/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Monkey being surprised GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o72F8t9TDi2xVnxOE/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So the Senate <a href="https://apnews.com/article/senate-infrastructure-bill-politics-joe-biden-a431f8c9f3f113b661cb3526512fc4e0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">did a thing</a> yesterday, passing a landmark $1 trillion infrastructure bill that will fund everything from roads and bridges to broadband networks and EV charging stations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We <em>say</em> $1 trillion, but <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/whats-us-senates-bipartisan-1-trillion-infrastructure-bill-2021-08-02/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new spending</a> accounts for $550 billion of the package, while the rest is previously approved funding. The legislation will move to the House next, where it could face some challenges.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Infrastructure is the rhythm section to the economy’s sax solo. Without smooth highways, good luck getting an Amazon package in two days. And, as we all learned over the last 18 months, a modern workforce can’t function without access to high-speed, reliable broadband.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This bill, which had support from all 50 Democratic senators and 19 Republicans, represents the biggest investment in US infrastructure in decades. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">3 things to know about US infrastructure spending</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It peaked with the New Deal: </strong>During the Great Depression in 1933, the federal government spent 2.96% of US GDP on infrastructure, and we haven’t hit that mark since. To <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/blog/the-avenue/2017/05/12/how-historic-would-a-1-trillion-infrastructure-program-be/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reach those heights</a>, according to Brookings, the US would need to spend $4 trillion over a decade, or roughly what it spends annually on national defense. This infrastructure bill won’t do that. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Most infrastructure investments are </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>not </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">made by the federal government. </strong>State and local governments accounted for <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/research/shifting-into-an-era-of-repair-us-infrastructure-spending-trends/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 78%</a> of all US public infrastructure spending in 2017. The idea is that local governments are more responsive to local needs; however, they’re often strapped for funds.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We lag behind other wealthy countries: </strong>The US spent 0.55% of its GDP investing in inland infrastructure in 2019, putting it behind peers like the UK (0.91%) and Japan (0.94%), and <em>way</em> behind China (5.56%), per the Council on Foreign Relations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With this infrastructure package, the Biden administration is trying to reassert the federal government’s role in public works spending. And while it’s not a New Deal, it is a big deal.  </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/influencers-want-get-vaccinated?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Influencers, Assemble
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/influencers-want-get-vaccinated?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Avengers " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTc2L2F2ZW5nZXJzLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Marvel's Avengers</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Benny Drama, aka Benito Skinner, aka the internet comedian with 1.4 million Instagram followers, released a <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CSXDyecgpMA/?utm_medium=copy_link" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">video</a> Monday in partnership with the White House to encourage “shots in the arms of every single American.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The video (and the only Benny Drama clip that’s appropriate to share in this newsletter) is one of many instances of US health leaders <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/01/technology/vaccine-lies-influencer-army.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">utilizing</a> social media influencers to fight Covid-19 vaccine misinformation and encourage young people to get vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>71% of Americans over the age of 18 are at least partially vaccinated. But only about 42% of teens aged 12–17 have received at least one shot, the lowest vaccination rate of any eligible group in the country. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>While Olivia Rodrigo grabbed headlines for her vaccine hype at the White House, most of the influencer work has been local. City and state health authorities are </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-technology-joe-biden-social-media-business-a2992b2881fcef68e1144efa7b869844?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tapping</a></span><span> micro-influencers to convince young people to vax up on their own turf.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Officials are ramping up influencer campaigns as another school year starts and more young people are getting sick from the Delta variant.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/soccer-icon-lionel-messi-signs-paris-move-will-reverberate-beyond-pitch?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Messi in Paris
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/soccer-icon-lionel-messi-signs-paris-move-will-reverberate-beyond-pitch?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TOPSHOT - Argentinian football player Lionel Messi salutes supporters fr..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTc0L3RvcHNob3QtZmJsLWZyYS1saWd1ZTEtcHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sameer Al-Doumy/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lionel Messi, considered by many the best soccer player in the world, <a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/paris-saint-germain--frapsg/story/4446700/lionel-messi-signs-with-psgto-wear-no-30-after-barcelona-contract-expired?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flew to France</a> yesterday and confirmed his stunning move from Barcelona to Paris Saint-Germain (PSG). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sports fans, we know we have your attention. Nonsports fans...here’s why this move will reverberate off the pitch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>PSG is a <a href="https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/NEWS/2020/03/17/all-you-need-to-know-paris-saint-germain?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relative youngster</a> on the international soccer scene, founded in 1970 by the merger of two other French clubs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everything changed in 2011, when Qatar Sports Investments, an arm of Qatar’s sovereign wealth fund, took over ownership. The Qatari government poured its oil money into PSG to increase the country’s global profile, turning the club into one of the richest soccer franchises in the world.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Even before signing Messi, PSG spent </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/lionel-messi-paris-saint-germain-11628607826?mod=hp_featst_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $1 billion</a></span><span> attracting the top names in soccer, and they made Brazil’s Neymar the most expensive player in the sport in 2017.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Gulf riches have so altered modern soccer’s economics that even some of the world’s biggest, richest, and best-supported clubs are now no match for state-sponsored teams in the arms race to acquire the most elite players,” <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/10/sports/soccer/lionel-messi-psg-barcelona.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the NYT</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Qatar will remain in the spotlight when it hosts the 2022 World Cup, but not without loads of controversy over alleged workers’ rights abuses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For fun: </strong>Craft a <a href="https://www.messimessages.com/us/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">personalized message</a> from Messi.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY TRACKSMITH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Back on Track
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/tracksmith/runners-sprint-back" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tracksmith" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMzQ0Ni8xNjI3OTI2NzYyLWRvd25sb2FkLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To many of us, a year or two of couch-bound laziness doesn’t sound like an awful fate. But to runners, months of forced lockdown sounds like talons on the world’s largest chalkboard.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">All that pent-up running energy is about to get let out in a big way:</strong> With pandemic restrictions lifting worldwide, an unprecedented wave of marathons are set to break over the world’s roads. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New York, Boston, Paris, London, Berlin, Washington D.C., and Chicago will all host tens of thousands of runners this fall.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ahead of mega marathon season, we spoke with two renaissance runners about balancing training and high-octane day jobs, the good vibes of the running community, and why now is the time to invest in your running gear, download a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/tracksmith/runners-sprint-back" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">training plan</a>, and get out there.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sponsored/tracksmith/runners-sprint-back" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Click here to read the full story.</a></p>
</td>
</tr>

</tr>
</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/key-performance-indicators-august-11?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Outdoor Equinox gym" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDg1L291dGRvb3JfZXF1aW5veF9neW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Equinox</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>About 9,000 health clubs in the US, or 22% of the total, have <a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-movie-rental-54a8021207d37650b9d96e55236553e1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> since the pandemic started, according to the International Health Racquet & Sportsclub Association. Meanwhile, Peloton broke ground on its first US factory in Ohio on Monday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“SpaceX could do it if need be.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1425100482779942936?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">volunteered</a> his company to make spacesuits for NASA’s upcoming moon missions, because, well, the agency’s spacesuit development is whatever the opposite of fast fashion is. NASA said making spacesuits could delay its goal of landing on the moon in 2024. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Grief, conspiracy theories, and one family’s search for meaning in the two decades since 9/11. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2021/09/twenty-years-gone-911-bobby-mcilvaine/619490/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/wework-teams-saks-fifth-avenue-instore-coworking?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TFW You Take a Zoom Call in the Changing Room
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/wework-teams-saks-fifth-avenue-instore-coworking?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="SaksWork rendering" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTc1L3Nha3N3b3JrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SaksWorks</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork is closing the loop on capitalism by building a string of <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wework-to-run-co-working-spaces-in-some-saks-fifth-avenue-stores-11628596800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coworking spaces</a><em> </em>within current Saks Fifth Avenue stores—so you can earn a paycheck and immediately spend it on Louboutins.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first five locations of the venture, known as SaksWorks, will open in the New York tristate area next month, including at the Saks flagship on Fifth Avenue.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Unlike its name, SaksWorks actually makes a lot of sense.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Brick-and-mortar retail, already pummeled before Covid, needs a life raft after drowning in pandemic closures. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And while many office workers plan to log in remotely even after their workplaces reopen, they may want a day or two uninterrupted by puppies, kids, and the siren call that is Netflix.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Converting stores into offices is such a sensical move, in fact, that SaksWorks <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/suburban-homes-and-retail-are-the-budding-new-office-hotspot-11620129603?mod=article_inline" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t even the first</a> to try it this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Turning stores into offices is the latest development in an ongoing quest to repurpose empty retail space, and it’s way less bizarre than when Spirit Halloween <a href="https://twitter.com/TORACHl/status/1043562375553712128?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1043562375553712128%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Ftoys-r-us-babies-r-us-stores-become-halloween-stores-2018-9" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">takes</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/PixieVenus/status/1041941294346633216?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1041941294346633216%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Ftoys-r-us-babies-r-us-stores-become-halloween-stores-2018-9" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over</a> an abandoned Babies R Us.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Websites you could spend hours on: </strong>Make your own <a href="https://musicboxfun.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">music box</a> and the OG <a href="https://kidpix.app/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kid Pix</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Niche work background music: </strong><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iCFylu5z5II" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Titanic vibes</a> (the good kind), <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8WhUkxMKhrI" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oldies</a> playing in another room while it thunders, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Igcb_LpP2yg" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">time travel to 1921</a>, and a <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ot3mxWak_L0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">medieval potion shop</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The post-pandemic workplace:</strong> Don’t worry, it’s not going to look like a scene out of <em>I Am Legend</em>. In fact, the biggest changes companies are planning for their offices are <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/10/biggest-changes-postpandemic-workplace-will-invisible?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pretty much invisible</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo the Senate \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/senate-infrastructure-bill-politics-joe-biden-a431f8c9f3f113b661cb3526512fc4e0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edid a thing\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, passing a landmark $1 trillion infrastructure bill that will fund everything from roads and bridges to broadband networks and EV charging stations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe \u003cem\u003esay\u003c/em\u003e $1 trillion, but \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/whats-us-senates-bipartisan-1-trillion-infrastructure-bill-2021-08-02/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew spending\u003c/a\u003e accounts for $550 billion of the package, while the rest is previously approved funding. The legislation will move to the House next, where it could face some challenges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eInfrastructure is the rhythm section to the economy’s sax solo. Without smooth highways, good luck getting an Amazon package in two days. And, as we all learned over the last 18 months, a modern workforce can’t function without access to high-speed, reliable broadband.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis bill, which had support from all 50 Democratic senators and 19 Republicans, represents the biggest investment in US infrastructure in decades. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e3 things to know about US infrastructure spending\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt peaked with the New Deal: \u003c/strong\u003eDuring the Great Depression in 1933, the federal government spent 2.96% of US GDP on infrastructure, and we haven’t hit that mark since. To \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/blog/the-avenue/2017/05/12/how-historic-would-a-1-trillion-infrastructure-program-be/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereach those heights\u003c/a\u003e, according to Brookings, the US would need to spend $4 trillion over a decade, or roughly what it spends annually on national defense. This infrastructure bill won’t do that. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMost infrastructure investments are \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003emade by the federal government. \u003c/strong\u003eState and local governments accounted for \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/research/shifting-into-an-era-of-repair-us-infrastructure-spending-trends/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly 78%\u003c/a\u003e of all US public infrastructure spending in 2017. The idea is that local governments are more responsive to local needs; however, they’re often strapped for funds.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe lag behind other wealthy countries: \u003c/strong\u003eThe US spent 0.55% of its GDP investing in inland infrastructure in 2019, putting it behind peers like the UK (0.91%) and Japan (0.94%), and \u003cem\u003eway\u003c/em\u003e behind China (5.56%), per the Council on Foreign Relations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith this infrastructure package, the Biden administration is trying to reassert the federal government’s role in public works spending. And while it’s not a New Deal, it is a big deal.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Paris Saint-Germain (PSG). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSports fans, we know we have your attention. Nonsports fans...here’s why this move will reverberate off the pitch.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003ePSG is a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/NEWS/2020/03/17/all-you-need-to-know-paris-saint-germain?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelative youngster\u003c/a\u003e on the international soccer scene, founded in 1970 by the merger of two other French clubs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEverything changed in 2011, when Qatar Sports Investments, an arm of Qatar’s sovereign wealth fund, took over ownership. The Qatari government poured its oil money into PSG to increase the country’s global profile, turning the club into one of the richest soccer franchises in the world.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEven before signing Messi, PSG spent \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/lionel-messi-paris-saint-germain-11628607826?mod=hp_featst_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e attracting the top names in soccer, and they made Brazil’s Neymar the most expensive player in the sport in 2017.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Gulf riches have so altered modern soccer’s economics that even some of the world’s biggest, richest, and best-supported clubs are now no match for state-sponsored teams in the arms race to acquire the most elite players,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/10/sports/soccer/lionel-messi-psg-barcelona.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the NYT\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eQatar will remain in the spotlight when it hosts the 2022 World Cup, but not without loads of controversy over alleged workers’ rights abuses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For fun: \u003c/strong\u003eCraft a \u003ca href=\"https://www.messimessages.com/us/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epersonalized message\u003c/a\u003e from Messi.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd while many office workers plan to log in remotely even after their workplaces reopen, they may want a day or two uninterrupted by
